It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures used for trapping aquatic invertebrates, a feature typical of its carnivorous relatives. The plant thrives in nutrient-poor freshwater environments, often found in shallow, still waters. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
